title: British Steel puts 2,700 jobs at risk at Scunthorpe steelworks
text:
British Steel puts 2,700 jobs at risk at Scunthorpe steelworks Chinese owner to close remaining blast furnaces at site after rejecting £500m state aid package as too low Robert Lea , Industrial Editor Friday March 28 2025, 1.36pm, The Times Scunthorpe has been making steel since the 1890s and is a key provider of rail tracks LINDSEY PARNABY/AFP/GETTY IMAGES Robert Lea , Industrial Editor Friday March 28 2025, 1.36pm, The Times

Link British Steel said it could close two blast furnaces at its Scunthorpe plant as early as June with the potential loss of up to 2,700 jobs, prompting a bitter row between ministers, the Chinese-owned company and trade union leaders.
Jingye Group has warned that the steel business is loss-making, and has been in talks with the government for months about securing funding to switch to a greener type of production.
But the two sides have failed to reach a deal, and British Steel said yesterday that it was making the “difficult decision” to start a consultation over the closure of its blast furnaces and other related operations.
